title: Man who shot himself arrested after deputies find meth in San Gabriel home
content:
SAN GABRIEL >> A man who accidentally shot himself is now a suspect after deputies discovered methamphetamines at a nearby home Tuesday night.
Sgt. James Long of the Sheriff’s Temple Station said the man was in stable condition at a hospital.
The Sheriff’s Temple Station received a call at 7:30 p.m. about a gunshot victim in the 5200 block of Walnut Grove Avenue, which is in the unincorporated county area near San Gabriel. People in the house made the call, according to Long.
Deputies found a man with a gunshot wound to the abdomen.
Lt. Brian Bishop of Operations Safe Streets Bureau, which is the gang unit for the Sheriff’s department, said the man was in front of a home.
“He needed medical attention because he shot himself,” Bishop said, adding that it appeared the shooting was accidental.
Bishop said deputies went inside the home to look for other possible victims and saw “a large amount of suspected methamphetamines.” He said a gun used in the shooting and ammunition were also recovered.
OSS secured a warrant and searched the house.
The man has not been arrested or booked. Bishop said charges are pending.
Bishop said deputies are still investigating the man’s connection to the house, the drugs and gun.
